result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe Orlando Dorsey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joe Orlando Dorsey not in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Joe Orlando Dorsey.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case adjourned to Branch 15 for a plea and sentencing on December 2nd, 2022 at 2:30 pm.

Defendant Joe Orlando Dorsey not in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Joe Orlando Dorsey.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel recently appointed and requests resolution date and bail bond hearing.
Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No driving without a valid license and insurance.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with V A B; R D H; D R H; C A L; T McD; N J S; S L T; A I W; N D W; and S D Y

Defendant Joe Orlando Dorsey appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Joe Orlando Dorsey.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference. This hearing MAY be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/104d9737-ba2f-8811-9083-aed2135824d9
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
